definitions.definition: To rest in a horizontal position on a surface.
definitions.example: The book lies on the table;  the snow lies on the roof;  he lies in his coffin

definitions.definition: To be placed or situated.
To abide; to remain for a longer or shorter time; to be in a certain state or condition.
definitions.example: The paper does not lie smooth on the wall.

definitions.definition: Used with in: to be or exist; to belong or pertain; to have an abiding place; to consist.
Used with with: to have sexual relations with.
Used with on/upon: to be incumbent (on); to be the responsibility of a person.
To lodge; to sleep.
To be still or quiet, like one lying down to rest.
To be sustainable; to be capable of being maintained.
To give false information intentionally with intent to deceive.
definitions.example: If you are found to have lied in court, you could face a penalty.

definitions.definition: To convey a false image or impression.
To be mistaken or unintentionally spread false information.
definitions.example: Sorry, I haven't seen your keys anywhere...wait, I lied! They're right there on the coffee table.

definitions.definition: The act of one who lies, or keeps low to the ground.
To rest in a horizontal position on a surface.
definitions.example: The book lies on the table;  the snow lies on the roof;  he lies in his coffin

Used with on/upon: to be incumbent (on); to be the responsibility of a person.
To lodge; to sleep.

To give false information intentionally with intent to deceive.

To be mistaken or unintentionally spread false information.

definitions.definition: An act of telling a lie or falsehood.
